title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4111.13 - Judge's scratch
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4111.13 - Judge's scratch

State Regulations

After declarations to a race have closed no horse may be
withdrawn except by permission of the presiding judge. The presiding judge
acting on personal knowledge, belief or discretion may order a horse scratched
from a race at any time prior to the actual start of the race, if the presiding
judge has reasonable grounds to believe that any rules have been violated by
any person connected with such horse. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4111.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
